title: How to stop annoying message
content:
I am running Windows 7 (and will not downgrade to one of the newer versions). Firefox has stopped supporting Windows 7 with version 115, which I am currently running. However, I get a pop-up message each time I launch Firefox asking if I want to download the latest version (which cannot be installed).

Is there some way to stop this annoying message from appearing?

Call me old-fashioned, but I miss Netscape...
creator: groston

title: Clicked on "never show" Bookmarks Toolbar by accident
content: I clicked on "Never show" Bookmarks Toolbar by accident. How can I reverse that so the Toolbar shows again?
creator: lmlumiere

title: Does FF save text used repeatedly?  Such as answers to common questions...
content:
FF 115.02 Win11 

I fill in many repeated responses, such as DOB, zip code, etc.  I was using Edge for a while and have forgotten the benefits of FF. Does it remember?

Can I edit or delete the ones that are no longer relevant or have changed - age, for instance?

Thank you.
creator: CiaoBella1

title: Mastodon not loading
content: When I load Mastodon from bookmark, FF finds the site OK but does not load a page. What I get is a black screen with no content. This started happening within the past week and I have not loaded any new extensions or themes. Other sites load a bit slowly but OK; the problem is with Mastodon only. Any advice to correct this problem is appreciated.
creator: joe.damiani

title: Suppress Security Warning
content: I run a local web server from my desktop PC. As the person running it, I access it only from my desktop PC, and only my account has a password. (All other accounts must be created by me, and have very limited access.) When I log in, Firefox whinges that it's not running on https, which is not my fault, as I didn't write this server. I cannot change servers. How can I prevent Firefox whinging about my lack of a secure (despite being local only) connection?
creator: the.tail.kinker

title: Windos system  firefox breakdown when it started，included diagnose mode.
creator: sxlljcwy

title: When I try to open Yahoo with Firefox as the browser, the first page freezes and there is no way to move on.  It opens just fine in Google. Help please. I do not want to use Google.
content: Yahoo has a first page announcing that they will not be serving China accounts. There is no way I can find to get past the first page in the Firefox browser, whereas in Google, it moved past that page and opened normally. Please help. Carl Warsowe [removed email from public]
creator: carlwarsowe

title: Since new update, new tabs open behind current tab instead of behind marked tabs
content:
Hey there!

Since the newest update (I think), whenever I select multiple tabs and attempt to open a new one via pressing the middle mouse button (or the MMB together with shift), the new tab opens behind the current open tab instead of the marked tabs.

For example: If I mark two tabs and have the left tab open, pressing the MMB on the + symbol would normally open a new tab to the right of those two tabs. Now, however, it opens the tab inbetween the two selected tabs.

Is there a way to change this back?
creator: Sbebruary_Sneedleston

title: Middle mouse button doubles as a back button when pulled to the left.... WHO ASKED FOR THIS/ GET IT THE *** OFF MY COMPUTER
content:
Whoever decided to add this needs to be fired, HOLY ****... I was about to buy a new mouse as the last one I had started failing by opening multiple new windows when i clicked the middle mouse button... so then i see the middle mouse button going BACK randomly, I assume my mouse is failing.

Luckily I google this problem and see that it's some kind of secret feature????? And I can confirm that other browsers do not do this... so it's FIREFOX who added this idiotic feature and didn't let anyone know?????

GET IT THE **** OUT OF THERE!!!!!!!!!!!!
creator: matthoefler
